alert.note: Alert for Imperial (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 20 at 5:34PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PDT TONIGHT... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Imperial. * WHEN...Until midnight PDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 534 PM PDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Tarantula Wash, Gert Wash, Carrizo Wash, Myer Creek, Hemlock Canal, South Alamo Canal, Salt Creek Slough, Fish Creek Wash, San Felipe Creek, New River, Ash Fifteen Drain, Alamo River, Palm Canyon Wash and Boulder Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... El Centro, Calexico, Brawley, Imperial, Plaster City, Ocotillo, Holtville, Westmorland, El Centro Naval Airfield, Mt. Signal, Mountain Spring, Calipatria, Dixieland, Seeley, Coyote Wells, Heber, Alamorio and Bonds Corner. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
